cte_events.event_name: Empower And Engage: High-Impact Teaching For Student Success
cte_events.event_facilitators: Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Join us for an interactive, informative session designed to transform your teaching to support student success. High-impact practices, such as community-engaged learning, collaborative projects, writing-intensive courses, and capstone seminars, are instructional practices that have been widely shown to benefit students from diverse backgrounds.
This session will equip you with actionable strategies to enhance course design, stimulate student engagement, and drive academic excellence. Perfect for educators seeking to invigorate their courses and inspire their students, this workshop offers practical tools to foster meaningful and engaged learning experiences that unlock student potential.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify high-impact teaching strategies and their implications for student learning and success.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44795

cte_events.event_name: Course Design Series: Session 1 - Crafting Learning Outcomes, The Foundation Of A Course
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Introduction to the course design cycle and learning outcomes as the foundation for a well-aligned course. Discover tools that support outcome creation/revision. Plan with course context such as level, class size, etc. in mind.
See examples and practice writing/revising learning outcomes and receive feedback. Additionally, explore ways to share learning outcomes with students through Canvas. Begin working on your course alignment map.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Define course situational factors most relevant to the overall course plan.
2) Create/revise learning outcomes that are student centered, meaningful, and measurable.
3) Generate a second level learning outcome by session or topic related to a course level learning outcome.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44796

cte_events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
The Center for Teaching Excellence is excited to invite you to the 2025 Digital Learning (DL) Expo. This On-site event will feature a series of engaging workshops designed to address the latest trends and innovations in the digital learning environment.
The event will include sessions related to Digital Accessibility, Generative AI, Third Party tools, New analytics, and frequently requested Canvas topics. Registrants will walk away with practical strategies that can be incorporated in all courses and will receive various resources.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify strategies that can be used in a variety of educational context.
2) Discuss the impact of the current trends in the digital learning environment.
3) Collaborate with peers to integrate the presented strategies.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44798

cte_events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
The Center for Teaching Excellence is excited to invite you to the 2025 Digital Learning Expo. This virtual event will feature a series of engaging workshops designed to address the latest trends and innovations in the digital learning environment.
The event will include sessions related to Accessibility, Generative AI, Third Party tools, New analytics, and frequently requested Canvas topics. Registrants will walk away with practical strategies that can be incorporated in all courses and will receive various resources.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify strategies that can be used in a variety of educational context.
2) Discuss the impact of the current trends in the digital learning environment.
3) Collaborate with peers to integrate the presented strategies.

cte_events.event_name: Connecting Classrooms And Communities: An Introduction To Community-Engaged Learning
cte_events.event_facilitators: Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Join us for an engaging interactive session designed to introduce faculty to the transformative practices of community-engaged learning. As our institution launches a new initiative focused on service and citizenship, this workshop will explore how instructional approaches that integrate civic engagement, community involvement, academic performance, and professional skills can enrich the undergraduate educational experience.
Participants will gain an insightful overview of these practices, discover practical strategies for incorporating them into their course design, and learn how to enhance student engagement and success. Whether you’re new to these concepts or looking to innovate your teaching methods, this session offers valuable insights and tools to make a lasting impact on your students’ learning journey.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Describe community-engaged learning and how it can both promote student success and have positive community impact.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44799

cte_events.event_name: Course Design Series: Session 2 - Designing Assessments
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Assessment choices are informed by course learning outcomes. Explore how assessments can enhance skill development and drive deep learning. Discover how balancing formative and summative assessments to provide timely, actionable feedback supports active engagement of learners.
Also, learn about different tools in Canvas that can assist with assessing students. Update your course alignment map.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify different type of assessments that align with learning outcomes.
2) Describe the importance of embedding formative assessments throughout the course.
3) Evaluate the alignment of learning outcomes with assessments for your course.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44802

cte_events.event_name: Digital Accessibility Series – Session 4: Utilizing Canvas To Check For Content Accessibility
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Back by popular demand, this series from the Spring 2025 semester returns. The recent Title II revision (the Final Rule) mandates that all digital content meet accessibility standards, ensuring usability for all users. This last session of the Digital Accessibility Series focuses on leveraging accessibility tools found in Canvas.
Discover how to effectively use Canvas’s built-in accessibility checker to identify and address accessibility issues within your course materials. Learn to interpret the Ally report, apply its recommendations, and improve the overall accessibility of your content.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify how to navigate and utilize Canvas’s built-in accessibility checker effectively.
2) Analyze and interpret accessibility reports generated by Ally.
3) Apply recommendations from Canvas and Ally to improve the accessibility of course materials.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44803

cte_events.event_facilitators:
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Staff and faculty have access to the protected version of Gemini, Google’s advanced AI. This workshop will introduce the basics of Gemini, exploring what it is and how it differs from other generative AI tools.
Additionally, participants will examine how Gemini can assist in content creation, assessment design, and brainstorming interactive learning experiences. Finally, participants will reflect on potential applications of Gemini in their own contexts.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify key features and capabilities of Gemini.
2) Experiment with Gemini by using different prompts.
3) Apply insights from the workshop to brainstorm potential uses of Gemini within participants’ own teaching contexts.

Register here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?ScheduleId=44781

cte_events.event_name: GSPDT | Reimagining Assignments: A Partnership Between Instructor And Artificial Intelligence
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Kelli Adam, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Join our workshop to discover the transformative potential of AI in education. You’ll learn to recognize the value of integrating AI into classroom assignments, review effective methods for adapting these assignments, and explore practical examples that foster critical thinking.
This session is designed to equip educators with the tools and insights needed to enhance student engagement and learning outcomes through Artificial Intelligence integration.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Recognize the value of adapting classroom assignments with AI integration in mind.
2) Review methods to adapt classroom assignments for AI integration.
3) Explore examples of AI integrated assignments that promote critical thinking.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44842

cte_events.event_name: Reimagining Assignments: A Partnership Between Instructor And Artificial Intelligence
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Kelli Adam, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:

3) Explore examples of AI integrated assignments that promote critical thinking.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44842

cte_events.event_name: Leaning On Generative AI And Pedagogy To Develop Exam Items
cte_events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
cte_events.event_description:
Creating high-quality exam items can be time-consuming. However, with well-crafted prompts and informed human decision-making, generative AI can assist in producing effective items that align with sound pedagogical practices. In this session, we will review current practices for developing exam items and explore strategies for prompting AI to generate questions across cognitive levels and in different formats.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Identify best practices for developing high-quality exam items aligned with pedagogical practices.
2) Apply effective prompting strategies to generate AI-assisted questions across cognitive levels and in various formats.
3) Evaluate the quality of AI-generated exam items and adapt them to your context.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44812

elp_events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
elp_events.event_description:
This workshop helps participants enhance their teaching and public speaking skills through microteaching demonstrations delivered in a low-risk environment. Each participant delivers a 5-minute presentation, receiving constructive feedback from a consultant and an undergraduate student on pronunciation, presentation structure, visual aids, nonverbal communication and more. By presenting in front of a friendly audience, participants develop confidence, and by observing peers’ presentations, they gain additional insight into best practices for comprehensible and well-developed presentations.

Learning Outcomes: 
Participants will be able to…
1. Construct and deliver short, well-structured and intelligible presentations.
2. Create a visual aid to support key points.
3. Identify areas for improvement in their own presentations and those of their peers.

elp_events.event_name: ELP Journal Club: A Conversation Circle For Text-Based Discussions
elp_events.event_facilitators: Michele Vick, Center for Teaching Excellence
elp_events.event_description:
Journal Club is designed for international TAs and faculty to gain confidence in reading aloud and leading and participating in classroom discussions about texts. Each week, participants will receive a short article two days ahead of time to prepare for our discussions. This workshop will focus on improving pronunciation, expanding vocabulary, and developing effective discussion strategies. Participants will also have the opportunity to lead discussions, enhancing their confidence and skills in academic settings.

Learning Outcomes: 
Participants will be able to…
1. Read aloud with comprehensible pronunciation and increased confidence.
2.Use key terms from academic texts accurately in discussions.
3. Effectively facilitate group discussions about various texts.
4. Employ turn-taking skills when participating in discussions.

elp_events.event_name: Conversation Circle For English Language Proficiency
elp_events.event_facilitators: Sarah Vargas, Center for Teaching Excellence
elp_events.event_description:
Conversation Circle is a supportive space for practicing spoken English through group discussions on cultural topics, including American university culture. Participants improve spontaneous speaking, active listening, and conversational turn-taking. Through communication with speakers from a variety backgrounds, they acclimate to different accents. The sessions promote social connections, intercultural dialogue, and a sense of belonging. The goal is to enhance English fluency, comprehension, and confidence.

Learning Outcomes:
Participants will be able to…
1. Employ effective spontaneous communication skills in social, academic and professional settings.
2. Elaborate on their viewpoints and opinions in group discussions.
3. Construct clear and well-structured responses during impromptu conversations.
4. Apply appropriate turn-taking and active listening techniques in casual group discussions and more formal academic discussions.

elp_events.event_name: Academic Communication Skills: Leading A Lab Class (Part 1)
elp_events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
elp_events.event_description:
Laboratory teaching assistants use key linguistic and pedagogical skills to enhance the learning of their students and to keep them safe while working with potential hazards. In this first of two workshops, participants will develop proficiency in communicating safety protocols, monitoring student engagement, and addressing confusion. The workshop will provide strategies for responding to student questions and resources for enhancing listening comprehension. For international instructors.

Learning Outcomes:
Participants will be able to…
1. Identify ongoing instructional duties in the lab, even when students are working independently.
2. Anticipate predictable communication, but also be prepared to respond to unexpected situations.
3. Choose the appropriate degree of assertiveness when giving students a suggestion or command.
4. Confidently initiate interactions with undergraduate students.
5. Utilize strategies for responding to confusing questions from students.

elp_events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
